page.title: 15ST.IVES "TIMES AND ECHO"
page.content: 1 St.Ives is one of the few places in England to have an independantly owned local newspaper. Established in 1910 the{Times and {Echo}has a circulation of four thousand but it is estimated to have a {saturation readership}of twelve thousand. Its two journalists cover stories of chiefly local interest. At present the{Dog issue}is the main story with articles and letters supporting and opposing the district council's dog ban on Porthmeor beach and it's introduction of a dog warden. The{letters page}is always lively and there are often{contributed}items on local history and the arts. Twenty people are employed by the printing company who publish the paper weekly, as well as being general printers and stationers.
